Half-Life: Opposing Force is an awesome expansion pack. 

Going back to the Black Mesa Research Facility felt nostalgic, but experiencing it from the perspective of a marine felt new and exciting. If you enjoyed the original Half-Life, definitely get Opposing Force.

Half-Life: Opposing Force is a great expansion to Half-Life, and provides a perfect balance between combat and problem solving, without being too hard or too tiring. The lore in this title is great, and you can piece together a lot with the dialogue from your allies and listening in on enemies. It's also fun to see the ways this and the original tie together, with you catching glimpses of Freeman at a different perspective. All in all, I would say Opposing Forces is an excellent expansion that rivals Half-Life in terms of quality, and in my opinion is even more fun. A must buy if you own Half-Life!

edit:
You wake at 3AM. Disturbed by some subtle shifting sound within the room, just on the edge of hearing. Propping up on one arm you survey the room looking for some source for the noise, hoping beyond hope that you wonâ€™t find one. At first, your hopes are raised, everything seems to be silent, everything seems to be still. But it isnâ€™t. 

From behind the long concealing drape of the curtain a voice, with flickering serpentine hiss whispers

â€œGo to sleepâ€¦â€. Suddenly, you know whatâ€™s about to happen and exactly who is waiting to meet you.

As recognisable and widely known as he is feared, Jeff the Killer, the eponymous villain of numerous stories littering the internet is one of the best known and most widely referenced Creepypasta characters to have emerged from the shadowy corners of the web over the past  few decades.

But exactly who or what is this infamous denizen of the darkness? Where did the character come from, how has it evolved and from which horrific pit of hell or the internet did â€˜thatâ€™ haunting image emerge?

If you're playing this expansion with the same mentality of the base game, or the other expansion you're doing it wrong. The ludonarrative dissonance is quite stark and the game will not make sense. But if you play as an asshole and go on a psycopathic rampage against the black mesa staff, starangely enough, it all works.

Some of the added content is very flimsy and gimmicky, and the little there is lorewise goes nowhere, but for the most part is fun enough,

By far one of my favorite Half-Life games, it adds a lot of new things that keeps the game extremely fresh and it's interesting to see the events at Black Mesa unfold from the Marine's perspective. Definitely worth the price, I highly recommend it.
